name: Conquer
text:
Enchant land
You control enchanted land.

editions.flavor:

—Avram Garrisson,
Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

"Every field watered in warriors' blood is sacred ground. Lay it not to waste, but claim it for our own—for glory, and for Stromgald!"

Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

"Why do we trade with those despicable elves? You don't live in forests, you burn them!"

name: Conservator

editions.flavor: Slivers are often seen toying with enemies they capture, not out of cruelty, but to fully learn their physical capabilities.

text:

editions.flavor: Priests of Bant protect their temples with traps more elaborate than any mosaic floor.

Defender

editions.flavor: Dimir rank and file never see nor hear their guildmaster. All orders are given through mysterious necrosages who appear from the shadows, tersely toss out a command, and then melt into the darkness.

"Others ask why the Eldrazi destroy. I ask why they preserve."

Flying

editions.flavor: Enlightenment comes most swiftly at life's end.

Enchant creature

name: Coralhelm Guide
text: {4}{U}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor: "She knows every step of this coastline, both above and below the surface, and she has hideouts all along the way. She will get you there."—Jori En, expedition leader
Early sailors thought they were tricks of the mind or perhaps manatees. As more and more ships were classified as lost to "manatee attacks," the truth began to dawn.
The coral merfolk delight in wrestling with their foes, skinning them alive on the razor-sharp edges of their reef.
Merfolk are best known for their subtle magic. But those who try to fight them in their own territory quickly realize that merfolk are hardly defenseless on the field of battle.
Merfolk are best known for their subtle magic. But those who try to fight them in their own territory quickly realize that merfolk are hardly defenseless on the field of battle.
It is not unusual for a single family of coral merfolk to spend centuries carefully guiding the growth of the reefs where they make their home.
